# Discord Chat Analysis for ğŸ’»â”‚developers

## 1. Summary:
The chat primarily revolves around UI development, player controller modifications, and app functionality in what appears to be a game development environment. Ashxn has been working on UI components and has completed most of the interface. There's discussion about modifying player behavior using apps, specifically for creating isometric character controllers. Community members reference examples like pew.bet where apps were used to modify player emotes. 0mka mentions working on side tabs for the UI and maintaining their own fork rather than merging changes. There's also conceptual discussion about "equipable skinned meshes" that would allow attaching items like watches, belts, or backpacks to player characters while keeping hands free. The conversation indicates ongoing collaborative development with UI improvements receiving positive feedback from the community.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: Is it possible to dynamically change the behavior/animations of the player controller exclusively using apps? (asked by cru) A: Yes, examples include Saori modifying player emotes in pew.bet and peezy implementing it in coliseum world for PVE fights, both using player.applyEffect({emote}) (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Which plugin are you referring to? (asked by jin) A: The fleek one (answered by peezy)
Q: Is anyone here in the Bay area? (asked by general hyper) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions:
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: cru | Context: Creating isometric character controller using apps | Resolution: Explained that others have modified player emotes using player.applyEffect({emote}), but noted that first person, isometric, and top-down views aren't as flexible as third-person implementations
Helper: hypb0gie | Helpee: Ashxn | Context: Confusion about empty message | Resolution: Clarified the concept of equipable skinned meshes like belts or watches for attaching apps to player characters

## 4. Action Items:
Type: Technical | Description: Implement equipable skinned meshes for attaching items to player characters while keeping hands free | Mentioned By: hypb0gie
Type: Technical | Description: Continue development of UI with side tabs | Mentioned By: 0mka
Type: Technical | Description: Explore isometric character controller implementation using apps | Mentioned By: cru
Type: Feature | Description: Consider adding rollercoaster tycoon building functionality | Mentioned By: Akuma

# Discord Chat Analysis for "âš¡â”‚general" Channel

## 1. Summary:
The chat primarily consists of casual conversation with minimal technical discussion. There was a brief mention of mobile optimization for Hyperfy worlds, with Roustan sharing links to both v1 and v2 mobile-optimized worlds. Some users discussed the viral "100 men vs 1 gorilla" concept that was trending on social media, suggesting it could be implemented in Hyperfy as a game or simulation. Users also mentioned market conditions affecting $hyper token price. The conversation included references to Hyperfy's capabilities for handling multiple assets and the potential for creating game-like experiences. Overall, the chat was more social than technical, with limited concrete problem-solving or implementation details.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: Can hyperfy v2 hold up good with that many assets? (asked by JUAN) A: Unanswered
Q: Doesn't anyone have any mobile optimized worlds? (asked by maximus) A: I'm trying to get my build smooth for mobile on v2. I have https://roustan.xyz and two v1 mobile worlds /pool and /roustan (answered by ğ•½ğ–”ğ–šğ–˜ğ–™ğ–†ğ–“)

## 3. Help Interactions:
Helper: ğ•½ğ–”ğ–šğ–˜ğ–™ğ–†ğ–“ | Helpee: maximus | Context: maximus was looking for mobile-optimized Hyperfy worlds to show to non-technical users | Resolution: ğ•½ğ–”ğ–šğ–˜ğ–™ğ–†ğ–“ shared links to his mobile-optimized worlds in both v1 and v2

## 4. Action Items:
Feature: Create a "100 men vs 1 gorilla" simulation/game in Hyperfy | Description: Multiple users suggested implementing the viral concept as a playable experience | Mentioned By: anon, Akuma, JUAN
Feature: Optimize more worlds for mobile performance | Description: Need more reliably performant mobile experiences to demonstrate to new users | Mentioned By: maximus

The chat segment is very brief, containing only a question about changing a world name in browser tabs and two responses. A user named ğ•½ğ–”ğ–šğ–˜ğ–™ğ–†ğ–“ is trying to change the name of a world that appears in the browser tab but has been unsuccessful despite multiple attempts. Two other users (.hyp shaman and ash) responded, with ash indicating that this functionality is available as a text input in the world settings menu, suggesting the solution is straightforward.
